messages.message:
@abhijnan Since, we switched over to OTEL as the tracer by default on local/crafting as well, its generating a lot of retry logs in celery-app-tasks, so much so that the actual logs are getting lost. Can you help take a look?
```[2025-07-22 07:56:32,918] [ForkPoolWorker-17/OtelBatchSpanProcessor] {/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/opentelemetry/exporter/otlp/proto/grpc/exporter.py:293} WARNING - [trace_id=] - Transient error StatusCode.UNAVAILABLE encountered while exporting traces to host.docker.internal:4317, retrying in 1s.
[2025-07-22 07:56:33,920] [ForkPoolWorker-17/OtelBatchSpanProcessor] {/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/opentelemetry/exporter/otlp/proto/grpc/exporter.py:293} WARNING - [trace_id=] - Transient error StatusCode.UNAVAILABLE encountered while exporting traces to host.docker.internal:4317, retrying in 2s.
[2025-07-22 07:56:35,922] [ForkPoolWorker-17/OtelBatchSpanProcessor] {/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/opentelemetry/exporter/otlp/proto/grpc/exporter.py:293} WARNING - [trace_id=] - Transient error StatusCode.UNAVAILABLE encountered while exporting traces to host.docker.internal:4317, retrying in 4s.
[2025-07-22 07:56:39,927] [ForkPoolWorker-17/OtelBatchSpanProcessor] {/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/opentelemetry/exporter/otlp/proto/grpc/exporter.py:293} WARNING - [trace_id=] - Transient error StatusCode.UNAVAILABLE encountered while exporting traces to host.docker.internal:4317, retrying in 8s.
[2025-07-22 07:56:47,929] [ForkPoolWorker-17/OtelBatchSpanProcessor] {/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/opentelemetry/exporter/otlp/proto/grpc/exporter.py:293} WARNING - [trace_id=] - Transient error StatusCode.UNAVAILABLE encountered while exporting traces to host.docker.internal:4317, retrying in 16s.
[2025-07-22 07:57:02,911] [ForkPoolWorker-17/MainThread] {/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/opentelemetry/sdk/trace/export/__init__.py:404} WARNING - [trace_id=] - Timeout was exceeded in force_flush().```
Looks like env is not set properly, taking a look
In model service too! Almost all services this is the case.
If we need to add some configs to crafting template, let's add them.
On crafting sandbox. So yes local.
Do you have `enable_tracing: true`  set in env-local-overrides?
Created a revert: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/72657 until I can find a solution
Does it affect only crafting envts?
crafting and local, I've merged the revert you can rebase on master for the fix
